column4: Traditional U.S. stores fight Amazon for online sales

column4: Seoul shares seen higher on China optimism  Wall St rally
column5: SEOUL  Sept 10 Seoul shares are set to rise on Tuesday as global markets  led by Wall Street  were buoyed by upbeat Chinese data that eased concerns of a sharp slowdown in the world's second-largest economy.      U.S. stocks rallied on Monday  with the Nasdaq ending at its highest level since September 2000  while the S&P 500 rose for the fifth straight session  posting its best daily performance since Aug. 1 as upbeat August trade and inflation data from China suggested that Asia's

column4: Koch brothers move into electronics with $7.2 billion Molex deal
column5: Privately owned Koch Industries will buy Molex Inc  a maker of electronic connectors for companies including Apple Inc  for about $7.2 billion to give the billionaire Koch brothers a way to diversify from their traditional holdings in energy  chemicals and paper.

column4: Iridium unveils new stand-alone satellites for hosted payloads
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 9 Iridium Communications  on Monday unveiled a new satellite concept aimed at helping governments and others put sensors and other payloads into space at half the cost of current programs.

column4: Iridium unveils new stand-alone satellites for hosted payloads
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 9 Iridium Communications  on Monday unveiled a new satellite concept aimed at helping governments and others put sensors and other payloads into space at half the cost of current programs.

column4: Sony pins hopes for profit on PlayStation 4  sets February launch in Japan
column5: TOKYO Sony Corp announced the Japanese release of its PlayStation 4 on Monday as the electronics maker braces for a console war with Microsoft Corp that could make or break the Japanese firm's struggle to return to profit.

column4: UPDATE 1-Sony pins hopes for profit on PlayStation 4  sets Feb 22 launch in Japan
column5: TOKYO  Sept 9 Sony Corp announced the Japanese release of its PlayStation 4 on Monday as the electronics maker braces for a console war with Microsoft Corp  that could make or break the Japanese firm's struggle to return to profit.

column4: Lower dose of Neurocrine's movement disorder drug fails in study
column5: Neurocrine Biosciences Inc said a lower dose of its experimental drug to treat a rare movement disorder did not meet the main goal of a mid-stage clinical study  sending its shares down 32 percent in after-market trade.

column4: New Formula E series gains two corporate sponsors
column5: LONDON The new Formula E electric motor racing series has signed up technology company Qualcomm and logistics provider DHL as corporate sponsors before its launch next September.

column4: Motor racing-New Formula E series gains two corporate sponsors
column5: LONDON  Sept 9 The new Formula E electric motor racing series has signed up technology company Qualcomm and logistics provider DHL as corporate sponsors before its launch next September.

column4: Umpqua Holdings in talks to buy Sterling Financial for about $1.8 billion: report
column5: Umpqua Holdings Corp  is in advanced talks to buy private equity-backed Sterling Financial Corp  in a deal that may be valued at about $1.8 billion  Bloomberg reported on Monday  citing people with knowledge of the discussions.

column4: Vodafone faces pressure to raise $10 billion Kabel bid: sources
column5: FRANKFURT/LONDON Vodafone is facing pressure from Kabel Deutschland's largest shareholder to raise its 7.7 billion euro ($10.1 billion) offer for Germany's largest cable company  two sources familiar with the situation said.

column4: UPDATE 3-Vodafone faces pressure to raise $10 bln Kabel bid-sources
column5: * Elliot Asset Management owns 10.9 pct of Kabel Deutschland

column4: Vodafone may fail to clinch Kabel Deutschland -paper
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 9 Vodafone may fail to reach the 75 percent threshold of acceptances from shareholders needed to clinch Germany's largest cable operator Kabel Deutschland  the Financial Times said on Monday.

column4: Western Digital buys flash memory maker Virident  focus now on Fusion-io
column5: Western Digital Corp said it would buy Virident Systems Inc for $685 million as the hard drive maker and Seagate Technology Plc battle for a piece of the fast-growing market for solid-state drives used in servers.

column4: UPDATE 1-Western Digital buys flash memory maker Virident  focus now on Fusion-io
column5: * Fusion-io shares rise 20 pct   (Adds details from conference call  analysts' comments; updates shares)

column4: Western Digital to buy flash storage company Virident
column5: Sept 9 Hard drive maker Western Digital Corp  said it would buy Virident Systems Inc  a maker of flash memory for servers  for $685 million in cash.

column4: UPDATE 2-KPN finance head quits with America Movil bid in limbo
column5: BRUSSELS  Sept 9 KPN's chief financial officer quit unexpectedly on Monday  leaving the Dutch telecoms group without a key executive as it negotiates with Mexico's America Movil  which is proposing a 7.2 billion euro ($9.5 billion) takeover.

column4: UPDATE 2-KPN finance head quits with America Movil bid in limbo
column5: BRUSSELS  Sept 9 KPN's chief financial officer quit unexpectedly on Monday  leaving the Dutch telecoms group without a key executive as it negotiates with Mexico's America Movil  which is proposing a 7.2 billion euro ($9.5 billion) takeover.

column4: Time Inc in talks to buy American Express magazines: report
column5: Time Inc  the magazine publisher that is preparing to spin out from its parent company Time Warner Inc  is in talks to acquire American Express' titles such as Food & Wine  according to a report in the New York Times.

column4: Time Inc in talks to buy American Express magazines - report
column5: Sept 9 Time Inc  the magazine publisher that is preparing to spin out from its parent company Time Warner Inc   is in talks to acquire American Express' titles such as Food & Wine  according to a report in the New York Times.

column4: Fieldwood Energy sets price guidance on $2.63billion loan
column5: NEW YORK Oil and gas outfit Fieldwood Energy set price guidance on its new $2.625 billion loan backing its $3.75 billion purchase of Apache Corporation's  Gulf of Mexico Shelf business  sources told Thomson Reuters LPC.

column4: RLPC: Fieldwood Energy sets price guidance on $2.63B loan
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 Oil and gas outfit Fieldwood Energy set price guidance on its new $2.625 billion loan backing its $3.75 billion purchase of Apache Corporation's Gulf of Mexico Shelf business  sources told Thomson Reuters LPC.

column4: JPMorgan in $300 mln settlement over force-placed insurance
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 JPMorgan Chase & Co and a major insurer have agreed to a $300 million settlement to resolve accusations that they forced homeowners into over-priced property insurance and entered into kickback arrangements that inflated the policies' prices.

column4: Bank of America to lay off thousands in mortgage business
column5: Layoffs at Bank of America Corp's  mortgage business will amount to about 2 100 positions  a source told Reuters on Monday  in response to weak refinancing activity.

column4: Bank of America to lay off thousands in mortgage business
column5: Sept 9 Layoffs at Bank of America Corp's  mortgage business will amount to about 2 100 positions  a source told Reuters on Monday  in response to weak refinancing activity.

column4: Merrill hires advisers from Goldman  Morgan Stanley
column5: NEW YORK Merrill Lynch Wealth Management has begun the school year by hiring a multi-million dollar private banker in Denver from Goldman Sachs Group Inc  and a two-person broker team in Miami that had been with Morgan Stanley  for 13 years.

column4: ON THE MOVE-UBS lands Morgan Stanley adviser in North Carolina
column5: Sept 9 UBS AG's  Wealth Management Americas said on Monday it had hired a veteran adviser from rival brokerage Morgan Stanley Wealth Management to join the firm in North Carolina.

column4: UPDATE 1-BCE goes to court to fight Canada's wireless rules
column5: TORONTO  Sept 9 BCE Inc   Canada's largest telecoms company  is taking Ottawa to court to fight government moves to assist new entrants in the wireless market as part of its policy push to increase wireless competition.

column4: Canadian telecom BCE files legal challenge to telecoms rules
column5: TORONTO  Sept 9 BCE Inc   Canada's largest telecommunications company  has issued a legal challenge to the federal government's indefinite extension of cellular tower-sharing and roaming rules designed to help new entrants to the market.

column4: UPDATE 2-Norwegian Air may seek compensation for Dreamliner problems
column5: * Airline suffers technical problems with both Dreamliners     * Both aircraft now back in service       OSLO  Sept 9 Norwegian Air Shuttle said it grounded a second Boeing Dreamliner within a week for a technical problem and will seek compensation for its troubles with the high-tech aircraft.     The airline operates two Dreamliners and lost use of both in the past week due to unrelated problems  forcing it to lease Airbus A340s on short notice  it said.     The Dreamliner  which se

column4: Bell teams with Lockheed for US Army helicopter bid
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 9 Bell Helicopter  a unit of Textron Inc  on Monday said it would team with Lockheed Martin Corp to bid for the U.S. Army's next-generation helicopter - an order worth billions of dollars - using Bell's V-280 Valor tiltrotor.

column4: Kuwait Airways may delay deal for Airbus jets: paper
column5: KUWAIT Kuwait Airways  may delay a plan to buy 25 new aircraft from Airbus   a Kuwaiti newspaper reported on Monday  saying the state-owned carrier would prioritize leasing planes instead.

column4: Norwegian Air has technical problem with second Dreamliner
column5: OSLO  Sept 9 Norwegian Air Shuttle has experienced its second technical problem with a Boeing  Dreamliner within a week and is frustrated with the time taken to resolve these issues  it said on Monday.

column4: Norway's oil fund buys Times Square property for $684 mln
column5: OSLO  Sept 9 Norway's $750 billion oil fund bought a 45 percent stake in the 47-story Times Square Tower in New York from Boston Properties  Inc. for $684 million  it said on Monday.

column4: Cameco delays start-up of Cigar Lake mine to 2014
column5: TORONTO  Sept 9 Cameco Corp said on Monday that it needed to complete additional work at its Cigar Lake project  delaying the start-up of the high-grade uranium mine until the first quarter of 2014.

column4: Iraq's Majnoon oilfield to begin producing 175 000 bpd next month
column5: BAGHDAD  Sept 9 Iraq's giant Majnoon oilfield  run by Royal Dutch Shell  will start up production next month at a rate of 175 000 barrels per day (bpd)  an oil ministry spokesman said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 2-SunEdison to divest semiconductor business  cuts sales outlook
column5: * Files for an IPO of up to $250 mln for semiconductor business

column4: Exclusive: Japan regulator probing Deutsche Bank entertainment of pension clients - sources
column5: TOKYO Japan's securities market watchdog is investigating whether Deutsche Bank AG employees provided excessive entertainment to Japanese pension fund executives in breach of regulations  sources with knowledge of the matter said.

column4: Ohio Davis-Besse reactor moves step closer to new license
column5: The U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission staff said there were no safety issues that would preclude a 20-year license renewal for FirstEnergy Corp's 894-megawatt Davis-Besse nuclear power plant in Ohio.

column4: Ohio Davis-Besse reactor moves step closer to new license
column5: Sept 9 The U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission staff said there were no safety issues that would preclude a 20-year license renewal for FirstEnergy Corp's  894-megawatt Davis-Besse nuclear power plant in Ohio.

column4: UPDATE 1-Japan's Toshiba set to buy U.S. natural gas from 2018
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 Japan's Toshiba Corp  has agreed to buy liquefied natural gas from the proposed Freeport LNG export plant in Texas  joining the ranks of global companies seeking to import some of America's growing fuel supplies.

column4: Opel cuts Ampera electric car price by 17 percent in Germany
column5: FRANKFURT General Motors'  European brand Opel has announced a 17 percent cut in the price of its Ampera electric car in Germany at this week's Frankfurt car show  where rivals will be showing off their electric models for the first time.

column4: UPDATE 1-Opel cuts Ampera electric car price by 17 pct in Germany
column5: * Opel cuts price for first time by 8 000 euros in Germany

column4: Suntory to buy GSK's Lucozade  Ribena drinks for $2.1 billion
column5: LONDON/TOKYO Japan's Suntory Beverage & Food Ltd is to buy GlaxoSmithKline Plc's Lucozade and Ribena brands for 1.35 billion pounds ($2.1 billion) to help it expand into new markets.

column5: LONDON  Sept 9 Japan's Suntory Beverage & Food Ltd has agreed to buy the Lucozade and Ribena brands from GlaxoSmithKline Plc for 1.35 billion pounds ($2.11 billion) in a deal that boosts its soft drinks portfolio and helps it expand into new markets.

column4: Suntory to buy GSK drinks brands for $2.1 bln
column5: LONDON  Sept 9 Japan's Suntory Beverage & Food Ltd has agreed to buy the Lucozade and Ribena brands from GlaxoSmithKline Plc for 1.35 billion pounds ($2.11 billion) in a deal that boosts its soft drinks portfolio and helps it expand into new markets.

column4: China locks foreign investors out of another bad-debt cleanup
column5: HONG KONG Chinese banks have a colossal mess of bad debts to clean up for the second time in as many decades  but they are unlikely to call in the financial world's most efficient mop and broom.

column4: RPT-South Korea probes 3 foreign brokerages including Goldman
column5: SEOUL  Sept 9 South Korean financial regulators are reviewing three foreign brokerages including Goldman Sachs Group Inc's local unit for possible breach of domestic capital markets regulations  a source at one of the regulators said.

column4: South Korea probes three foreign brokerages including Goldman
column5: SEOUL South Korean financial regulators are reviewing three foreign brokerages including Goldman Sachs Group Inc's local unit for possible breach of domestic capital markets regulations  a source at one of the regulators said.

column5: SEOUL  Sept 9 South Korean financial regulators are reviewing three foreign brokerages including Goldman Sachs Group Inc's local unit for possible breach of domestic capital markets regulations  a source at one of the regulators said.

column4: ANALYSIS-Hospital investors wary of slow rampup for Obamacare
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 Investors in U.S. hospital companies are counting on the Obama administration to pull off its national healthcare reform for 2014 to drive earnings growth  but a series of delays to the program has some questioning how strong the launch will be at its start.

column4: JPMorgan's board takes some power from Dimon
column5: JPMorgan Chase & Co's  board  under fire for the bank's trading losses and myriad government probes  said on Monday that it was adding two directors and handing more power to its lead independent director  steps that give it extra supervision over Chairman and Chief Executive Jamie Dimon.

column4: JPMorgan CFO sees higher litigation costs
column5: The chief financial officer of JPMorgan Chase & Co  said on Monday that the company will build its litigation reserves in the third quarter at a cost that will "more than offset" the benefit of a simultaneous release of extra reserves it had taken for mortgage losses.

column4: JPMorgan CFO sees higher litigation costs
column5: Sept 9 The chief financial officer of JPMorgan Chase & Co said on Monday that the company will build its litigation reserves in the third quarter at a cost that will "more than offset" the benefit of a simultaneous release of extra reserves it had taken for mortgage losses.

column4: JPMorgan names two new directors  changes board rules
column5: JPMorgan Chase & Co's  board  under fire for failing to prevent the $6 billion "London Whale" trading losses last year  on Monday named two new directors and gave more power to its lead independent director  but critics said the moves did not go far enough. | Video

column4: JPMorgan to name Linda Bammann  Michael Neal to the board
column5: JPMorgan Chase & Co  said it expects Linda Bammann  former director of Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp   and Michael Neal  former GE Capital CEO  to join its board of directors.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 U.S. stocks were set for a modestly higher open on Monday in the wake of upbeat economic data from China  though concerns remained about the possibility of a Western strike against Syria.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures gain on China data; Syria concerns remain
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 U.S. stock index futures advanced on Monday in the wake of upbeat economic data from China  though concerns remained about the possibility of a Western strike against Syria.

column4: US STOCKS-Futures rise after China data; Syria concerns remain
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 U.S. stock index futures advanced on Monday in the wake of upbeat economic data from China  though concerns remained about a potential strike against Syria.

column4: Jacobs Engineering to buy Sinclair Knight Merz for $1.2 billion
column5: NEW YORK Jacobs Engineering Group Inc   one of the world's largest construction consulting firms  said on Sunday it would acquire Australian employee-owned consultancy Sinclair Knight Merz (SKM) for approximately A$1.3 billion ($1.2 billion) in cash.

column4: Young analyst draws Wall Street ire taking on Kinder Morgan
column5: HOUSTON Kevin Kaiser  a 26-year-old analyst only three years into his first job out of the Ivy League  jolted Wall Street last week with a pithy email taking aim at North America's largest oil and gas pipeline and processing company - Kinder Morgan.

column4: Bell teams with Lockheed for US Army helicopter bid
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 9 Bell Helicopter  a unit of Textron Inc  on Monday said it would team with Lockheed Martin Corp to bid for the U.S. Army's next-generation helicopter - an order worth billions of dollars - using Bell's V-280 Valor tiltrotor.

column4: ON THE MOVE-Merrill hires advisers from Goldman  Morgan Stanley
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 Merrill Lynch Wealth Management has begun the school year by hiring a multi-million dollar private banker in Denver from Goldman Sachs Group Inc and a two-person broker team in Miami that had been with Morgan Stanley for 13 years.

column4: ON THE MOVE-UBS lands Morgan Stanley adviser in North Carolina
column5: Sept 9 UBS AG's  Wealth Management Americas said on Monday it had hired a veteran adviser from rival brokerage Morgan Stanley Wealth Management to join the firm in North Carolina.

column4: China locks foreign investors out of another bad-debt cleanup
column5: HONG KONG Chinese banks have a colossal mess of bad debts to clean up for the second time in as many decades  but they are unlikely to call in the financial world's most efficient mop and broom.

column4: RPT-Sailing-Oracle win shows New Zealand has not locked up America's Cup
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Sept 8 Oracle Team USA edged out Emirates Team New Zealand in a blustery fourth race for the America's Cup on Sunday  reminding the Kiwis  who won the first three races of the event  that the American yacht is formidable.

column5: TORONTO  Sept 9 BCE Inc   Canada's largest telecommunications company  has issued a legal challenge to the federal government's indefinite extension of cellular tower-sharing and roaming rules designed to help new entrants to the market.

column4: ANALYSIS-Hospital investors wary of slow rampup for Obamacare
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 9 Investors in U.S. hospital companies are counting on the Obama administration to pull off its national healthcare reform for 2014 to drive earnings growth  but a series of delays to the program has some questioning how strong the launch will be at its start.
